business.headline: Agents' body questions GST cut, says move undermines insurance distributionPrashant Mhatre, All India President of the General Insurance Agents Federation Integrated (GIAFI), has sounded an alarm, saying the decision risks weakening the role of agents, brokers, and advisors who are central to India's insurance reach.
Planning a personal loan? Don't make these 5 errorsWhile personal loans can be a handy financial tool, they come with risks if mismanaged. Avoid these five common errors to keep your finances safe.

Wintrack vs Chennai Customs is a sorry tale of grease of doing business in IndiaChennai-based logistics company Wintrack has ceased Indian operations, alleging repeated bribery demands and harassment by Chennai Customs, exposing the ugly truth that at Indian Customs integrity is the real contraband.

Delhi government may revise circle rates, public feedback invitedThe Delhi government is considering a revision of circle rates across the city and has called on the public to share their views before any changes are finalised.

Health insurance in 2025: Key traps that could drain your pocketClauses such as room rent caps, deductibles, and co-pay options are often buried deep in policy documents but can have a massive influence on the claim process.
Sensex, Nifty recover losses to end higher fuelled by gains in metal stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 223.86 points to close at 81,207.17, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 57.95 points to end at 24,894.25.

63% of households aware, yet only 9.5% invest in markets, Sebi survey showsDespite growing awareness about investing in the markets, the latest Sebi survey shows that only a small fraction of households, i.e., just 9.5%, are actively investing.

Looking for high returns? This small savings scheme beats PPF and NSCMany investors assume PPF or NSC offer the best returns, but the scheme leads the pack with the highest interest among small savings schemes. Have a look.

Will Zerodha end its zero-brokerage model for equity delivery trades?Zerodha, long known for offering free equity delivery trades, could soon charge for delivery trades for the first time, signalling a major shift for investors.

Bigg Boss 19 slips to 20th spot 'Bigg Boss 19' has fallen to twentieth position on the TV ratings chart after previously ranking eleventh last week. This shift highlights changing viewer preferences and the sustained dominance of leading Star Plus shows.

Boney Kapoor says Khushi got 100% scholarship from New York Film Academy Film producer Boney Kapoor recently shared that his actor-daughter Khushi Kapoor secured a 100% scholarship to the New York Film Academy. He said Khushi secured the scholarship based on her audition tape.

Why OTT reminds of Doordarshan of the eighties and nineties (and in a good way) In recent years, streaming platforms have emerged as launchpads for actors young and old who were struggling for a break in films, much like Doordarshan in the eighties and nineties. IndiaToday.in analyses the parallels.

Yash, Upendra praise Rishab Shetty's Kantara: Chapter 1 for raising the bar Rishab Shetty's Kantara Chapter 1 was released on October 3, 2025. Actor Yash praised the film in his X review called it a "truly immersive experience on screen."

Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha is the cosy K-drama you will never get over In this week's K-fix we discover why 'Hometown Cha-Cha-Cha' is the ultimate feel-good K-drama, from its seaside charm to heartwarming characters and cosy, healing storytelling.

Daughter was asked for nudes during video game: Akshay Kumar recalls cyber horror Akshay Kumar has recalled an incident when his daughter was asked to send nude photos while playing video game a few months back. He urged mandatory cyber period in schools at a recent event.

Bhagwat Chapter One trailer: Jitendra Kumar sheds good guy image in crime thriller The trailer of Bhagwat Chapter One Raakshas starring Arshad Warsi and Jitendra Kumar is released ahead of its Zee5 premiere on October 17. The film delves into crime and psychological drama set in Uttar Pradesh, promising a gripping narrative.

The Ba***ds of Bollywood trends globally; Aryan Khan reflects on challenges, joy Aryan Khan's 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' is trending globally. Amid the success, the director reflected on the challenges and joy of shooting the series.

Ram Charan showcases archery skills at Dussehra event, wife shares video Actor Ram Charan threw arrows at Raavan effigies during Dussehra festivities on Thursday. His wife Upasana Konidela posted a video of the event on social media. Have a look.

Cillian Murphy's Peaky Blinders confirmed for two new seasons Cillian Murphy's historical crime drama 'Peaky Blinders' will be back with two new seasons on Netflix, following the franchise film 'The Immortal Man', which is slated to release in 2026.

Sahher Bamba recalls meeting Shah Rukh Khan, praises Gauri Khan Sahher Bamba shares her memorable experience meeting Shah Rukh Khan and Gauri Khan. She highlights the warmth and motherly care shown by Gauri Khan on the sets of 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'.

Neeraj Ghaywan reacts to reports of paying less compensation to Homebound family Director Neeraj Ghaywan reacted to reports of paying less compensation to the family on whom 'Homebound' is based.  The filmmaker set the record straight with his post on social media.

Bigg Boss 19 ep 40: Farrhana vs Ashnoor, housemates compete for captaincy Farrhana Bhatt and Ashnoor Kaur had a huge fight over house duties in the latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19'. Earlier in the day, all the contestants competed against each other to clinch captaincy contendership.

Priyanka Chopra receives cute handmade card for daughter Malti on flight to US. Pics Priyanka Chopra returned to the US after her Mumbai trip and shared a sweet handmade card from Emirates for her daughter, Malti Marie Chopra Jonas.

Taylor Swift's The Life of a Showgirl: Mother has fed us again Taylor Swift's 12th studio album 'The Life of a Showgirl' review: It is fast, fun and fierce, proving once again why she's the ultimate mother of pop music.
Bobby Deol joins Delhi's Ramlila celebration, burns Ravana's effigy on Dussehra Bollywood actor Bobby Deol made Delhi's Ramlila more exciting this Dussehra by burning Ravana's effigy at the Red Fort.

It reveals the human cost behind the fighter's public glory and personal struggles.

Sharvari begins shooting for Imtiaz Ali's next, wishes Dussehra with special note Bollywood actor Sharvari has begun shooting her next film with acclaimed director Imtiaz Ali, co-starring Vedang Raina, marking the start of the project on Dussehra with a special puja.

general news.headline: TVK abandoned stampede site, reflects leader's mindset: High Court blasts VijayThe Madras High Court criticised TVK leaders over the Karur stampede, accusing party chief Vijay of fleeing the scene. The court also ordered formation of a Special Investigation Team to probe the case.

English didn't rule India: Musk-shared post slammed for whitewashing pastTech tycoon Elon Musk faced backlash after sharing white supremacist Stefan Molyneux's post denying British colonisation of India. Critics, including Indians, accused the supremacist for enabling historical whitewashing by denying British colonialism. Historians and commentators pointed to the immense human and economic toll of colonialism. Such denials are as dangerous as Holocaust revisionism.

Stop state-sponsored terror if you want place in geography, Army chief warns PakGeneral Dwivedi further spilt the beans by instructing the Indian troops to stay prepared and on standby, hinting they may get another opportunity to unleash their firepower soon.

Rahul Gandhi's analogy draws BJP's 'gibberish' jibeCongress leader Rahul Gandhi's explanation on why cars are heavier than motorcycles during a talk has sparked a political row. Linking vehicle weight to engine safety and electric mobility, Gandhi's remarks were mocked by BJP IT chief Amit Malviya, who called them "gibberish".

Pakistan Army is a mercenary force, once butchered 25,000 PalestiniansFrom the 1970 Black September in Jordan when Pakistani troops under Zia-Ul-Haq's command butchered 25,000 Palestinians, to the brand-new defence pact with Riyadh, Pakistan's generals have long fought for whoever signs the biggest cheques. The latest deal with Saudi Arabia, with a promise of a nuclear shield, is the latest chapter in Rawalpindi's long mercenary ledger.

Apple Watch Ultra saves life of 26-year-old Mumbai techie after scuba diving accidentThe robust health and environment tracking in devices like Apple Watch can prove to be life-saving. As the Apple Watch Ultra recently did in the case of Kshitij Zodape, a Mumbai resident who was scuba diving in Puducherry a few months ago.

In Balochistan, where Dussehra was once homeDussehra in Balochistan (A province in Pakistan) – this may seem unreal now, but in the 1920s, during colonial rule, the region witnessed the burning of Ravana's effigies year after year. The popular festival brought the Hindu community together in a spirit of cohesiveness. It wasn't just Balochistan. Records show that Dussehra was celebrated widely in other parts of present-day Pakistan too. From Lahore to Sindh, the festival was popular and vibrant. Let's take a dive into this once-popular tradition in the history of Balochistan.

Nasa is closed. American space agency shuts downDay-to-day communications from the agency have gone silent, with social media channels dormant and updates on ongoing missions delayed. Critical operations, however, remain active.

Watch: Dhruv Jurel's guard of honour tribute for armyman father after maiden Test tonDhruv Jurel scored his maiden Test hundred against West Indies in Ahmedabad on Friday. His emotional guard-of-honour salute paid tribute to his father, a retired army Havildar, who fought in the Kargil War.

sports.headline: Fifty celebration for dad, hundred for army: Jurel after Ahmedabad century Dhruv Jurel revealed that he dedicated his maiden Test hundred to the Indian army after he pulled off a unique celebration after reaching the landmark. Jurel helped India maintain control over West Indies on Day 2 of the Ahmedabad Test.

Was for my daughter: Rahul explains new hundred celebration during 1st Test KL Rahul revealed that his new celebration was dedicated to his daughter after getting a well-made hundred during the Ahmedabad Test against West Indies. Rahul continued his fine run with the bat with his hundred.

Dhruv Jurel strengthened claim for pure batter spot with century vs WI: Parthiv Patel Former India wicketkeeper Parthiv Patel lauded Dhruv Jurel's maiden Test century against West Indies. He said the 125-run innings strengthens Jurel's case for a regular spot as a specialist batter in India's Test XI.

His 190-ball effort showcased his skill, temperament, and ability to perform as a top or middle-order batter.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
